prompt:
Nurse: I'm glad to hear that, Mr. Cardenas. How about a new or worsening dry cough?

Patient: No.

Nurse: That's good to hear, Mr. Cardenas. Now, have you noticed any increased swelling in your feet, ankles, stomach, or legs?

Patient: No.

Nurse: That's great, Mr. Cardenas. Have you gained more than 2 pounds in the past day or 5 pounds in the past week?

Patient: No. I haven't gained any weight.

Nurse: That's good to hear, Mr. Cardenas. Lastly, have you been using more pillows at night to sleep?

Patient: No.

responses.gpt4: That's good to hear, Mr. Cardenas. So far so good. What we just did was a simple CHF assessment, something you can do at home every day to monitor your symptoms. Do you have any questions about how to do these checks?
responses.our_model: That's great, Mr. Cardenas. We just performed a simple CHF assessment. It's a good idea to keep track of these symptoms at home every day. I understand that keeping track of symptoms can be a bit complicated. Do you have any questions about how to do so?
